concept.title: Mask Types
concept.shortdesc: You can use the following mask types to mask data:

dlentry.dd: Replaces values with a fixed-length mask. Use when you want to mask any variability in length in the data.

The following example uses a fixed-length masks to hide passwords:
Original Password 1234 donKey 022367snowfall
Fixed-Length Mask asd302kd0 2v03msO3d L92m1sN3q
Replaces values with a variable-length mask. Use when you want to reveal the lengths of the original data.

The following example uses a variable length mask to hide the same passwords:
Original Password (original) 1234 donKey 022367snowfall
Variable-Length Mask asd3 2v03ms L92m1sN3q0jaOmE67Ws
Replaces values with a mask based on a user-defined pattern.

When you define the pattern for the mask, you can use a hash mark (#) to reveal the character in that location of the hash mark. All other characters are used as constants in the mask. For example, the following mask pattern reveals the area code of a phone number and replaces all other digits in the phone number with an x: ###-xxx-xxxx.To avoid confusing masking characters for real data, use a single masking character.
